intro: Campylia holosericea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campylia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats.
